item.title: Expert 2 and 3: Data Collection Analyst on Gender Equality in Public Administration
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Study on Gender Equality in Public Administration in the Western Balkans

The overall objective of this assignment is to contribute to strengthening girl’s and women’s voice and participation in the Western Balkans, in particular, women’s empowerment and expanded participation in policy-making and leadership in the executive branch of the state. The study will cover the Western Balkans (Albania, Bosnia & Herzegovina, Kosovo*, the former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Montenegro and Serbia) and should achieve the following specific objectives:

  • Provide an overview of the current state-of-play, barriers and challenges to women’s participation in decision-making, both participation in public policy/strategy development and participation in leadership positions. The analysis will focus on the thematic area ‘strengthening voice and participation’ identified in the Gender Action Plan.

  • Analyse country-specific legal frameworks, policies and initiatives indicating major constraints and enabling factors of promoting gender equality and women’s empowerment in public administration.

  • Identify policy and programming recommendations for further action, including specific entry points for the EC to advance women’s equal participation in public administration.

Expert 2 and 3: Data Collection Analyst on Gender Equality in Public Administration (maximum 70 working days)

Education:

University Degree in relevant area such as Public Administration, Public Policy, Social and Political Sciences, Gender Studies, International Law, Development Studies, or equivalent.

General experience

  • At least 3 years of relevant professional experience one or more of the areas of gender, governance (with particular emphasis on public administration reforms), and/or data collection;
  • Experience with extensive online research;
  • Experience with quantitative research and data collection;
  • Knowledge of decision-making processes in public policy, public service delivery, institutional capacity building, human resource management policies, professional ethics and/or civil service reform would be desirable;

Specific experience

  • Good knowledge of the international framework on gender equality and women’s empowerment, particularly in the area of women’s participation in policy and decision-making and leadership;
  • Knowledge of the EU Gender Equality Policy and Gender Action Plan would be considered an asset;
  • Previous experience in the Western Balkans in issues related to public administration reform and/or gender equality will be a strong asset.

Language skills:

  • Excellent spoken and written English
  • Knowledge of any of the languages spoken in the Western Balkans would be a distinctive advantage.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to elena_bellitto@dai.com

item.description:
Feasibility study for extending the Bwanje Valley Irrigation Scheme

The present contract aims to conduct a feasibility study for the extension of the Bwanje Valley Irrigation Scheme, enabling inclusive growth in rural communities based on improved and sustainable use and management of water, soils and other natural resources. The global objective of the program is to contribute to Malawi’s Government objective of poverty reduction in line with the Malawi Growth and Development Strategy (MGDS). The specific objective of the program is to increase agricultural productivity and food security of rural communities. This will be done through the improvement of systems and processes, strengthening of implementation capacities and delivery of inputs to final beneficiaries.

  • Knowledge in water and terrestrial ecology.
  • Familiar with internationally recognised environmental safeguards, guidelines and recommendations.

*General professional experience *

  • expertise in carrying out identification and feasibility studies for natural resources management projects.

item.description:
Governance and Public finances Management Sector Review to Mongolia

The global objective of the assignment is to undertake a review of the Governance sector (for this assignment the scope of the term governance will focus on public sector reform, management of public finances and civil service reform) in Mongolia that will provide information for an implementation strategy for the EU in the Governance sector.

Specific objectives

The specific objectives of the assignment are:

  • To assess previous Governance sector strategies and reforms in Mongolia, identifying the main obstacles that hindered the achievement of development outcomes.
  • To assess the Governance sector performance and policies, identifying the main challenges and opportunities for the new Government to carry out successful reforms and policies in this sector.
  • To carry out a risk analysis for budget support operations in the country
  • To identify areas of intervention and aid delivery methods with its pros and cons, for the EU development cooperation in the Governance sector for the period 2017-2020.

Expert in Governance/ Public Finance Management (Cat. II)

  • University degree in Law, Political science, Economy, sociology and/or equivalent proven professional experience of at least 6 years related fields.
